review.itemreviewed: I/O MAG S Goggles Replacement Lens
review.reviewBody: Sometimes you just need to protect your eyes from the cold wind or the snow coming down, but the light is so flat that any tint in the goggles makes it harder to see. These lenses are perfect for those conditions! And I love that I can swap out lenses and I don’t have to carry three pair of goggles whenever I go skiing!
review.name: I Can See Clearly Now

review.itemreviewed: I/O MAG S Goggles Replacement Lens
review.reviewBody: With this new lens I now have 3 to cover me in all conditions. Love this product
review.name: Fantastic goggles

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Not as good in flat light as prior Smith goggles.

review.reviewBody:
Comfy and so far no leaks, I will leave an updated review on how long they last.

However, please make a better way to adjust the shoulder straps. It’s time for improvement. The standard straps just plain suck.
review.name: Better shoulder straps adjustments would be nice

review.reviewBody: Best waders I’ve owned. A must for winter inshore wading.
review.name: Best waders

review.reviewBody: Great fit with enough room to layer. Extremely dry and durable. I wish there was a pocket inside and zipper definitely need to get use to.

While I have not used them yet I will give them 5 stars for the fit so far. 
 I paired the waders with the salt boots for striper fishing and so far I am completely satisfied with the overall fit and feel while in them. That said a little hiking and fishing in them will tell the whole story. So far so good.
review.name: Initial review of zip up freestones

review.reviewBody:
I have now had three pairs of Freestone waders, the last of which was the zip model and I do believe the convenience of the zipper justifies the cost differential. I probably spend around 75 days a year in waders with around half of these being hard use days consisting of climbing over rocks, busting brush, and hiking. At this level of use, the Freestones have lasted me 2-3 seasons before they are at the end of their service life and I find this very acceptable for the price point. 
All of the waders ultimately failed in high abrasion zones in the seat/crotch/between thighs due to the waterproof membrane layer becoming worn and delaminating from the other layers and tearing. This may sound bad, but after hundreds of miles of abrasion and wet-dry cycles this is all one can expect from Toray fabric in a properly fitting and cared for wader. 
The 4 layer Toray is fairly puncture-resistant. Despite most of the thorns and brush contacting the 4 layer portion, most of the pinholes would be in the thinner upper portion. 

Overall, I was very pleased with the durability and features of the Freestone line for the price point, but have since upgraded to a Gore-Tex wader. If you expect to put as much wear and tear on a pair of waders as I do, then you may consider doing the same, but for causal anglers looking for a solid and feature rich offering you've found the best value with the Freestones.
review.name: The best value for casual anglers

review.reviewBody: My favorite waders! Ease of getting into/out of with zipper + durable knee and lowers super suitable for my work measuring rivers.  I don't mind being in these all day and with the right layering good for field work no matter the weather.
review.name: Streamgagers delight!

review.reviewBody: Great product. Fits well. A little stiff when cold
review.name: I would recommend, great affordable option to the G4Z

review.reviewBody: I had the previous generation Freestone Waders and they took 3 years of abuse, 3-4 days a week on the water and exceeded my expectations. I recently bought the new Freestone Zs and they are fantastic! The stitching makes for a better feel and better mobility. The fit, flex, and new gravel guards are top notch. The storage pockets are nice along with the tool docking area. The zipper is heavy duty and is convenient allowing for easy in and out and will be useful when nature calls. I have no complaints. I look forward to many, many days on the water with these waders!
review.name: Great Quailt, Fit, And Feel.

name: Freestone Z Stockingfoot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Freewheel Ride Short - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got a pair in the spring then got another and now looking for another colour.
review.name: Great pockets and fit

review.reviewBody: I am so stoked that Outdoor Research started a MTB line. These short a great: they're very durable, they have roomy pockets, they hold their own out on the mountain. The vents are nice, they are very stretchy and can accommodate a chamois no problem. One feature I love are the side cinches at the waist. Men's hiking and biking pants always have this feature, but it's really rare to find women's pants or shorts that do, so KUDOS to OR! If it were about 1" thicker that would be perfect, so it would feel more distributed like a belt instead of a cord.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: Being a plus size rider, it's difficult to find shorts that are comfortable, breathable, have a good stretch, and actually look good. These shorts are all of the above plus some. The pockets are great for phones/keys not much else, which is ideal or else you end up putting everything in there and look like a chipmunk. I do wish they had belt loops. The waste is slightly too big but the legs fit like a dream. They don't slide down too much but I do find myself having to adjust a bit more when stopping for water/looking at a map. But great shorts over all!
review.name: Fav mtn bike shorts to date

review.reviewBody: OR has always been my go to for everything outdoor apparel, so I was stoked to see they're making MTB gear now! The Freewheel shorts blow every other pair of shorts I own out of the water. They're true to size, durable (haven't crashed them yet though), and insanely comfortable. The locking snap is really nice too! I'm usually a large in shorts across the board with thick thighs, and the 12 fit perfectly with no gapping in the waist.
review.name: New Daily Drivers

review.reviewBody:
OR being a solid brand in snow, to no surprise do I love these MTB shorts.. WOW seriously the best fitting shorts I own and I have more shorts then a normal person should. Super stretchy, PERFECT inseam (just above the knee), phone pocket ideal and waist is perfection... insert chef's kiss here. 

Definitely worth the investment because this will be the only pair you will want to wear!
review.name: Loveeeeeeee

review.reviewBody: I was excited to see OR is making MTB product now! These shorts are awesome. I am anywhere between a 8-12/L in bottoms, and I got the size 10. The fit is spot on. I love the slide lock snap closure, and they seem super durable. I am deciding if I need a second color now!
review.name: Great shorts!

name: Freewheel Ride Short - Women's

review.reviewBody:
great sun gaiter! I bought 3 and i will buy more soon 
I wish that simms would make a gaiter like the shirts that connect to their sunshirts and have the same top so they stay put.
review.name: Great Gaiter for those sunny days.

review.reviewBody: Very nice for sure, comfortable, airy... I purchased as I thought the breathing holes would stop my sunglasses from fogging.... sunglasses still fog up
review.name: Nice... but

review.reviewBody: Works great for Spring skiing. Comfortable, excellent coverage and easy to breathe through .
review.name: Love it !

review.reviewBody: Great product.  Perfect length and holes help breath unlike other products.  Very lightweight and comfortable.
Great! Breathable and doesn’t fog up my sunglasses. Excellent sun protection.
review.name: Sungaiter

review.reviewBody: Awesome neck gaiter stays on doesn’t slip off and doesn’t bunch up even when you just have it on your neck great protection from the sun
review.name: Great products

review.reviewBody: Great, wear outside the hoody and it keeps your hat on running the boat
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I live in Texas where the sun can be unmerciful. I bought the Simms sun gaiter in an effort to be able to be more comfortable longer on the water. It worked as advertised! The vent in the mouth area made it so comfortable to spend hours on the water and I got no sun burn at all. Great product!
Really like it. Just wish they had some more of the lighter colors like the gray. Those sold out pretty quickly. Does not ever seem like they get more in.
review.name: Love it but need more lighter colors.

review.reviewBody: Perfect lightweight fit, stays up in place, you can cover your mouth or not
review.name: Sun Gaiter

name: SunGaiter

description: Buy the Dynastar M-Pro 108 Ti F-Team Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: M-Pro 108 Ti F-Team Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dynastar M-Pro 108 Ti F-Team Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are fall line missiles exactly as advertised. Only buy this ski if you want to move fast and have the skill to do it safely because they do not handle well without being driven. Excellent ski if you have the strength and will to stand on them and go. 

Tighter, smaller, more treed resorts are not this ski’s native habitat. Big and open making the true 22m long radius turns is home for these. 

Do know they are not 108 waisted, they are 110. 

This ski isn’t forgiving but it sure does deliver as advertised. If wanting a more forgiving, handles itself well slow or fast, and more maneuverable in variable terrain and snow, look to the MFree 108. I love them both, but boy are they different
review.name: Exactly As Advertised Except…110

name: M-Pro 108 Ti F-Team Ski - 2025

description: Buy the Hestra Windshield Liner Glove online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Windshield Liner Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hestra Windshield Liner Glove online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Windshield Liner Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hestra Windshield Liner Glove online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
They fit of the gloves is great, with an intentional design that would suggest they'll hold up for some time. However, they would be perfect if they were lined with fleece, making them a mid- or heavy-weight liner. 

For winter or spring ski touring during milder conditions, these are all you'd need. The pull tab makes them easy to manage when on skis, and since there is a loop, you can feed some of Hestra's wrist leashes through them, which make these very ideal for skiing or snowshoeing ? especially with a dog like me. 

Most recently, I took these to the Boundary Waters Canoe Area in January to use as my base layer gloves. By and large, they worked out great. 

I snowshoed a good distance with them in cold, windy conditions. My body temp made it so these worked well for the conditions. I also gathered and chopped firewood in them. Unfortunately this is a pretty messy process, so they became too wet before long and were basically unusable until dried. But, they held up. No holes, no split or undone seams. 

The placement of added protection and fabric surely did the job. They also worked well with my phone. Although, I noticed the thumb of these gloves was a bit long, which made it hard to use my phone with my thumbs. That could use improvement. 

Overall, a nice glove but at a higher price. If you're looking for a simpler liner with smartphone compatibility, you could find just as nice gloves at a lower price point. I've used comparable gloves for similar applicable at half the price. But even still, I'll keep and use them.
review.name: They need more weight / warmth

name: Windshield Liner Glove

review.reviewBody: Despite the dingle BOA, these fit fairly well. I used to use G8 insoles, but I haven’t put them in these - I can feel enough arch support as is. I will experiment with the G8s later. I do wish there were 2 BOAs for an even nicer fit, but for the money, these are quite comfy. And carbon soles are great.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody:
I've bought quite a few pairs of Lake shoes since buying my first MX176, and finding they fit my feet better than any other shoe I've tried. I don't have an especially wide foot, it's fairly normal, but as most probably know, most cycling shoes are designed for people with skinny little feet. And Lake's Competition last as used on this shoe and the 238 line, fits my foot perfectly. I have a couple pairs of the CX 238 shoes, but when I saw these in red, I had to get a pair. 

This shoe uses the same Competition last and carbon sole as found on their more expensive 238 line. The cost cutting differences from that more expensive shoe come from the use of only a single Boa dial that only adjusts in one direction, nylon loop lace guides rather than hard plastic, and the use of Clarino synthetic material for the upper instead of real leather. These differences do make for a lighter shoe. But, here come the quibbles. 

On the bike, and in use, this shoe feels pretty much the same as the more expensive 238. Stiff, great power transfer, lots of wiggle room for the toes. And that's where it counts, right, the performance. However, the Clarino is not as supple feeling as real leather, so the shoe doesn't quite have that slipper-like comfy feeling that the 238 has. Maybe with more use, it'll get there.  Likewise, the single Boa dial means there's a lot of wire that dial has to reel in, so the separation of the upper at the tongue area, and the shoe opening, isn't as wide as on the 238. So you can't pull the shoe open as far when slipping it on, which makes it a bit tougher to get in and out of. But also makes for a secure fit. And the tongue material is a bit thicker and spongier than on the 238, so when putting your foot into it, it has a tendency to get stuffed down a bit toward the toe of the shoe, so you have to tug it back up again before tightening. You also have to fiddle with the Boa wires a bit to make sure they cross over on those sewn in Carbotex patches. They have a tendency to get caught up on the edges, so you need to adjust and move them around a bit so they cross over properly before cinching them down. 

Still, better than the previous version with single Boa and a strap, which I found pretty useless.  On my MX176 shoes, I adjusted the strap the first time I put them on, and then never touched it again. No need for adjusting it at all. I applaud Lake for getting rid of it, it makes for a better looking shoe. The 219 now looks more like the higher level 238 line rather than the cheaper 176 line, although the new 177 adopts that styling as well.  Fine by me, as I think the 238 is a great looking shoe. 

So, the quibbles are really pretty minor, in that you get a shoe that performs like the higher level 238, but for $100 less. If your feet like Lake shoes, and that's all the budget allows, you won't be disappointed with these shoes.
review.name: A less expensive 238 with a few quibbles

name: CX219 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Based on the description and the other reviews, I expected this bell to be much louder than it actually is.

I have another, much less expensive bill on my other pipe that is louder than this one.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: Bought the Spurcycle bell after reading up on some reviews. In short, it’s the best bike bell money can buy. Imitators can be bought at a fraction of the price, but the secret sauce of a real Spurcycle bell is that the bell itself is made from a brass alloy that creates a tone that is more clear and has a longer sustain than its competitors. The bell comes with mounting hardware for both diameters of handlebars (mountain bike and road bike round bars). There is a Youtube video which explains the installation process. Please watch it prior to installation. It is a little pricey but it can be had for 20% off as long as you wait for REI or Backcountry coupons, which are offered a few times a year.
review.name: Best bike bell in town!

review.reviewBody: Loud sound, it startles some bypassers, seems durable and hope it lasts
review.name: Great sound that carries

review.reviewBody: There's a knock-off (really a few knock-offs!) of the Spurcycle Bell on the market, but nothing beats the original! This has the fit, finish, and sound you'd expect from a great product. It's assembled by hand, in the USA, so make sure to support the real company that developed this bell, and not one of the cheaply-made copy cats.
review.name: Great Bell! Support Local Companies

review.reviewBody: I've had this bell for several weeks and I'm very satified with it. The design and build are top-notch. It's perfect for alerting folks from behind that I'm approaching. It's pleasant tone and moderate volume level illicit smiles. The all-black version seamlessly blends with the look of my handlebar array and the small size is perfectly in scale. I highly recommend!
review.name: Lovely bike bell

review.reviewBody: A simple, beautifully crafted bell with a delightful tone! Able to transform an annoying alert to a pleasant experience.
review.name: wonderful tone

review.reviewBody: This is a great bell. It's loud enough that most people wearing headphones notice, and it's smaller than many other larger, quieter bells. It can be challenging to slot the attachment piece inside of the bell, but it's very secure once it's attached. I would recommend getting a thin rubber strip to go between the handle bar and the bell's metal attachment piece. It could scratch the handle bars, and for me, it can get dampened by the handle bar grips.
review.name: loud and low profile

review.reviewBody: I saw one of these at a local store and wanted to get a dark one with the green button. When it arrived I saw how well designed it was and when mounted it emits a very distinct sound that can be heard by the folks on the bike path who are normally oblivious to the outside world. Very well made and the fit and finish is superb. I now have 4 of these bells for various bikes and just love them. I took advantage of a limited time discount which made the bell even better. The nice thing about the sound is that when you are coming up behind someone, the distinct  sound lets them know something is coming.  I would highly recommend this product. thanks for keeping them in stock.
review.name: One the coolest new additions to my bike

review.reviewBody: I loved my old bell, I thought the ring was clear and loud and then it fell apart and was replaced by this Spurcycle bell. Holy Cow!! I didn't know what clear and loud was until now! This thing gives off the clearest, long resonating, loud ring I think I've ever heard outside of cathedral bells. One pull of the trigger and it just sings forever. At first I wasn't sure if it was a good thing. I like bells on the trail because they sound way more polite than shouting "RIDER" at the top of your lungs to address the person walking their dog with noise cancelling headphones on. This thing is startlingly loud and yet cheerful sounding. The mount is also very secure although I put a stip of inner tube in between the metal strap and my carbon bars. It's also good to know that it will even go around a 35mm bar if you need/want to place it near the clamping area instead of near the grips. I have mine right above my dropper lever though. Looking forward to more alerted trail users on my rides going forward!
review.name: Ridiculously good

review.reviewBody: Expensive, yes.  Does what it is designed to do exceptionally well, yes.  Light, clean & unobtrusive install in the cockpit while being easy to use, yes.  High quality materials, durable, easy to install unless you are not very good with tools or "digitally challenged".  These are awesome, I have four of them one each for my road and gravel bikes and for my wife's.  My first is on my road bike and has 5 years and over 40,000 miles of riding on it through all manner of conditions.  In my view it is simply perfect for bike trail, multi-use trail, and road riding.  No, it will not cut through intense urban traffic noise, for which you would need a bloody air horn anyway, but for everything else is get the job done very nicely and as others have stated the tone and duration is highly effective without being irritating.  I use it for passing other cyclists, warning runners and pedestrians, and signaling my approach to blind corners.  As others have also said it will also cut through most earbud users who are oblivious to the world around them though not so effective on over-ear noise cancelling ear muff users. Highly recommended.
review.name: Have not had or seen better!

name: Bell

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots to walk the Camino Santiago in Spain, this fall. The second day of our six week trek The rain came down and I was sloshing in these boots. I can say is that everyone I spoke to on the trail said their boots were also supposed to be waterproof and they weren’t. I bought a waterproofing spray and used it m, which seemed to help, as we continued on the journey. The boots are very comfortable, have a wide foot bed for me. I never experienced any blisters or any other issues with these boots. They were very comfortable for me walking hundreds of miles.
review.name: Great, but not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots which I have been testing on various trails for a week. Instantly comfortable, Great grip. Decent looking. A bit lighter weight than my other hiking boots but ankle support feels equally secure.
review.name: The perfect boots

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The sole feels great, however, they claim these are the original keen toe box and these things are narrow and tight. Really squeezes across the base of my toes and ball of my foot. I have never had Keens that fit like this, definitely not the roomy toe box they claim to be and not close to the original fit I’ve worn in the past.
review.name: Tight tie box.

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought 2 pairs of keen nxis 
Yes they are comfortable but once they’ve gotten wet they smell horrible.
Nothing I’ve tried to get the smell out has worked.
review.name: Once wet they smell

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: At first I felt like the ankle support was pressing into me but after wearing a few times it adjusted to my foot. I wear a 6.5 typically and I ordered these in a 7, glad I did. Great fit!
review.name: At first I felt like

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love them- they are warm and have good traction in the snow. 
They were comfortable the first time I put them on!
review.name: Love them- they are warm

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live on a farm. I usually wear the wear the Targhee II (my favorite ) with upgraded insoles. I bought these hiking boots as a lighter waterproof shoe for the summer months around the farm. They are comfortable and truly waterproof. I have a narrow foot. I wear the same size in these as the Targhee II. However these boots are a tight fit to get on. It’s a true struggle to push my foot down through the ankle area. The toe is very roomy. They are very supportive around the ankle.
review.name: Lightweight Summer boot

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife for summertime hikers. In winter she has the Pyrenees leather hikers and likes them a lot too. Seeing reviews these run a bit small we ordered 1/2 size bigger and they fit her perfectly. Keen boots are all we wear on the trail these days.
review.name: wife loves them

review.itemreviewed: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Such comfortable shoes straight out of the box, I didn't even need to break them in. After reading others reviews, I decided to size up by 1/2 size and am glad I did to give enough room for thicker socks during the colder seasons.
review.name: Great purchase!

name: NXIS Evo Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product was an okay item. We did use it for camping and it kept us semi warm but I don’t think it’s that great of a product. It’s definitely great to have.
review.name: OKAY

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great little emergency blanket to keep in the car. It’s compact and lightweight and traps in heat efficiently. It feels very durable and warm, and perfect for emergency situations like bad weather.
review.name: Practical emergency blanket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thermal blanket works just fine. Like the fact that came with whistle and it has a satisfactory length to accommodate your legs. The biggest down side it gets wet after few hours due to condensation.
review.name: Great option

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is perfect for outdoor sports that parents have to sit in the cold weather and his was nice and warm and very insulated. Good for camping trips too.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] SOL Thermal Bivvy w/ Rescue Whistle is very convenient to maintain body heat in necessary situations.  Convenient to have on hand. I received this product for free from Influenster and Sol in exchange for my honest review.
review.name: Convenient

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sol Thermal Bivvy was given to me for free in exchange for my honest review. It’s light and compact, can be taken on a hike or take little to no space in the car trunk. Includes rescue whistle. Doubles up as a sleeping bag as well as a blanket/cover.
review.name: Handy item to have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] SOL Thermal Bivvy w/ Rescue Whistle is an excellent addition to keep us warm in even extreme temperatures. I live in Buffalo and I've been left without heat and this is a good option to have on hand at times like this. I received this product for free from Influenster and SOL in exchange for my honest review.
review.name: Keep us warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is built well and seems to be something that will last a while.  It will be going into the emergency bag for the car and will be especially handy for the winter months on these country hwys. It compacts nicely and won’t take up much space.
review.name: Compacts down small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so excited to add this to our camping gear! It seems very durable, comfortable, and provides great insulation! The rescue whistle is a nice add on as well!
review.name: Exciting

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was incentivized by Influenster and Sol with this complimentary product in exchange for my honest review.

This thermal bivvy is exactly the way it is described in the product description.  It has a sleeping bag type construction and seems to hold heat well.  It’s pretty warm out so I haven’t been able to test it in cold climates yet.  The seams are velcroed together on one side.  There is a ventilation opening with mesh at the bottom of you need circulation.  I took one star away for the whistle.  Its range is not far enough to be heard long distances.  My boyfriend could not hear me blowing into it (in the front yard) from the backyard.  I also removed one star for the cinch bag that it came in.  Once you unfold the Bivvy, it’s impossible to refold it tight enough to fit back into the bag…as you can see from the picture.  The material is so lightweight that it will not cooperate with you when you were trying to refold it. You would definitely need a second person to help you refold it any smaller to fit inside of the bag.
review.name: Bivvy is good quality, whistle sucks!

name: Thermal Bivvy

hasVariant.name: Limestone Lanai Screen Room
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Limestone Lanai Screen Room online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Our young family loves a day at the beach and this sun shelter is the ultimate homebase!  The open floor allows the kids to play in the sand while still in the shade and then we can zip it up to keep our valuables somewhat safe when it's time to go play in the water.  We have easily hosted six seated adults plus several kids sitting on the sand for lunch.  

We've had it set-up in moderate 10-15mph winds - no issue with some stakes and using coolers/gear bags to weight down the corners.  We love it!
review.name: Homebase at the Beach

review.reviewBody:
This sun/bug shelter is awesome in theory, but failed miserably in a moderate breeze. We set it up in our backyard for the first time today. We had maybe a 8-10mph breeze/wind and it smashed the shelter down to the ground like a pancake, bending both of the ridge poles. 
There are only 4 places to guy-out this very high profile unit, which is a pure design flaw from Marmot (sorry, but it's true). It needs about 8 more guy-out tabs, or an extra ridge pole or both. I've owned many Marmot products in the past and this is their first true miss. 
I don't know anywhere I could go and use this where it would not be susceptible to up to a 10mph wind. Family camping trips, youth sporting events, the beach, hunting base camp, etc. There is no way it would hold up to the outflow winds of even a small passing storm cell, so the fact that one of its features is to keep some water off of you in a rain is pretty much academic. I had high hopes for multiple uses for this Lanai, but it didn't last 20 minutes on a sunny blue bird day in my back yard. I'm going to need to contact customer service to have the poles replaced at a minimum, or simply return the shelter completely for a refund.
review.name: Weak Sauce
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the Limestone my Dad had one and now I have one and my family loves it for all their camping adventures. When I saw that they came out with a limestone sun shelter, I had to have it. 

This thing is built like a tank and will stand up to anything. Our first trip was to the Oregon coast and it stood up while other peoples shelters were flying down the beach. What I love most about it though is the screened doors. Its pretty much a second tent with these screen doors they keep out the sand and the bugs. There is nothing better than sitting in there on a mosquito filled evening and enjoying the great outdoors in comfort.
review.name: THE BEST SUNSHELTER ON THE MARKET

name: Limestone Lanai Screen Room

description: Buy the Garmin Edge 1050 GPS Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Edge 1050 GPS Bike Computer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Edge 1050 GPS Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased my Edge 1050 about 3 weeks ago.  I’ve owned several Garmin Edge computers in the past and this is easily the best.  I love the bright display and design.  Battery life is really good.  The music interface is one of my favorite features!  Negatives for me include not find a way to sync my heart rate from my Apple Ultra Watch (I gave up and purchased a heart rate monitor strap I didn’t want), Strava segment set-up took too long to figure out and the unit is really expensive.
review.name: Great Display

review.reviewBody: I bought a 1040 and sent it back because it didn’t have volume control and some other features so I sent it back and got the 1050.  This really out performs my old 1030.  I just wish there was a hands on class to show you how to use all the new features.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few weeks ago.   It has a very nice screen and I love the vibrant colors. I wouldn’t use this for racing, but it’s definitely a good choice for training and longer rides.
review.name: 1050 edge

review.reviewBody: this was a pleasant surprise- I upgrade my devices pretty much every other release - vs. the 1030 this is a massive improvement across the board!
review.name: More intuitive and responsive

review.reviewBody: Jump from a 1030+ to the 1050.  It’s so much better, and faster! I was also surprised how easy it was to set up. I’m still learning about it, but it seems straightforward.
review.name: Happy

review.reviewBody: Coming from a 1030, turns on faster, loads faster, connects to sensors faster, tones for radar are better, has a amazing bike bell and bonus with DI2 you can set up one of the option buttons to ring bell instead of on the screen. and did I mention the screen? works smoother, much more like you smart phone and just looks so much better.
review.name: WOW

review.reviewBody: My first ride told me I made the right investment.  The screen is beautiful and so easy to read, night and day between my 830 which was a challenge to read. I love the features, the bell, the climbing function, the light network, the training. Wifi updates are slick too. The battery only went down to 82% after a 1 1/2 hour ride. I look forward to more miles with it.
review.name: Impressive GPS Computer

review.reviewBody: The Edge 1050 is a beast !  side note: the jubilation of ownership is diminished with a LONG learning curve to familiarize and used all that the 1050 offers.  It takes a few minutes before the ride to get all the sensors on line between the speed, cadence, HMR-PRO - Varia RCT 715, front and rear lights and the enduro 2 watch.  Struggling to synch the electronic gears to the 1050.  During the ride its info overload, screens, data and what are all these sounds it's making and which has precedence the 1050 or the Enduro?  more mysteries to be solved!  The real game changer is the situational awareness provided by the Varia RCT-715!  This is an absolute necessity for anyone who rides on the roads.  Again - a steep learning curve but slowly getting through trial and error.  Garmin makes superb equipment.  Hope to benefit from it all soon.
review.name: Garmin 1050 - love it but struggling!

review.reviewBody:
I love my Garmin 1050 
Nice graphics, faster, bright colors
review.name: Garmin Edge 1050

review.reviewBody:
I love Garmin products and I have been using them for a while but this Edge 1050 was absolutely the only exception.. it kept freezing up while while biking, tried restarting it over and over literally 1 week after purchase. so not sure if the entire line has an issue or just mine was a lemon but I sent back within 30 day for hopefully full refund - I bought 1040 
standard instead I haven't received yet. so hopefully better based on reviews.
review.name: Stopped working 1 week after purchase !!!!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: My girlfriend loves the color and warmth of her ghost whisperer and is amazed at how light it is. I got a great hug for getting it for her!!
review.name: Girlfriend Approved!

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: So lightweight yet so warm. This jacket fits really well/flattering and true to size!
review.name: So lightweight yet so warm

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: poor quality stitching already falling out just had it for a few weeks
review.name: expensive and cheap

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love, love, love this jacket! So warm and packable. And I love the color.
review.name: Best Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cozy, warm, and lighter than any other jacket I have. So glad I finally bought one.
review.name: Like wearing a Cloud

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is very light and warm but I wouldn't say that it is warmer than other down jackets in it's bracket.  The armpits are weirdly high and restrictive which makes it difficult to wear when performing activities, and creates a cold spot.
review.name: Lot of hype, bit of a letdown

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I took this jacket out for a weekend in Vermont and New Hampshire that included leafing peeping, hiking up in the White Mountains, and visiting the local brewpub–this jacket was awesome for all of the above! It's incredibly lightweight and packed down well into a small pocket of my backpack. It kept me super warm, it fits well, and it's amazingly comfortable and cozy.
review.name: Cozy, Lightweight, and Trail-Ready

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve only tried it on so far, and loved it immediately. So much so, that I bought a second one for my future second rain shell to match with it 🙈
review.name: I have 2️⃣

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm and lightweight.   Like that can use drawstring to tighten bottom of jacket to fit hips.  Perfect length.  I’m 5’7” and 130 lbs.  large fits well.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m excited to try this coat out backpacking in the Sierra Nevada. I preferred the large size so I could move my arms freely.
review.name: Ghost Whisperer

name: Ghost Whisperer Hooded Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: regularly commuting with this as my lid.  good price. works well at temps that I need an neck warmer for.

review.reviewBody: Fits well, warm, low profile.
review.name: Solid helmet

review.reviewBody: Fits well, had a bad fall but my head was safely secured and just got a minor concussion
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: It is perfect for what I use it for! I highly recommend this helmet if you are on a budget. It is very high quality and looks great on!
review.name: It is perfect for what

review.reviewBody: I bought a black BOLT helmet 4 years ago and the finish matte layer didn’t stand the test of time… This new BOLT model / finish seems better. We’ll see. Love the model.
review.name: I bought a black BOLT

review.reviewBody: Love the helmet. Definitely the best bang for your buck.
review.name: Love the helmet. Definitely the

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my grandson for Xmas. My daughter waited too long to get a ski winter pass, so I’m holding on to it until next year. But it worked out great as we didn’t get any snow this year.
review.name: Funny Story.

review.reviewBody:
Wish there was a little bit more Padding. Fit is not bad. 
Advertised and showed that the sunglasses and goggles fit under the visor when not wearing but not really
review.name: Wish there was a little

review.reviewBody: Fits great, so comfortable as well! Doesn’t look bulky or anything, and feels very secure. Would highly recommend!
review.name: Fits great, so comfortable as

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, lightweight, great color and fit! Gave me confidence to try and push myself on the slopes.
review.name: Gma’s ski too!

review.reviewBody: I call these my Pants, capital P. I have zero notes, they’re perfect. Huge pockets, reinforced knees, waist hits at my actual waist, did I mention multiple huge pockets? I will wear these forever.
review.name: The Perfect Pants

review.reviewBody: I was initially very excited to receive these pants, as the material quality is really fantastic and looks ready for hard-core use. But after trying two sizes, they just don't fit. I would have thought that for such rugged-ready pants they would expect to make room for a little more musculature around the upper legs and thighs, but it's completely tight and pinching. No way I can use these while climbing over logs off-trail. I even have narrow hips, so this was a bit shocking.
review.name: Bummed about poor fit

review.reviewBody: I ordered these because I was looking for a pair of autumn-winter weight, significantly water resistant hiking trousers that would fit my 5 foot 3 inch 100 lb frame. These are very roomy but the waist band is small enough to keep them from falling down. So, I decided to keep them. They are warm and they kept me completely dry through hours of hiking in light-to-moderate rain. Also, they don't make an annoying whispering noise as you walk.
review.name: Smallest size is still a bit roomy

review.reviewBody: I have 2 older style fit trousers (I still love them and they are holding up well) but I love the new improvements. The new style actually flatters ones bum. The older styles didn't really do much for the rear view, but Fjall is correct (improved fit ) is an understatement. Great quality, and now an even better fit. The fit guide is spot on. Don't skip the measurement part  (and don;t be afraid when you are a bigger size than you are used to, the fit guide is accurate). This is my 4th pair of Fjallraven trousers (all different styles) and I love them. This is the thickest pair I have and great for fall/winter or off trail to prevent scratches.
review.name: great for cool weather or off trail traverse

review.reviewBody: Bought for my wife, fit is excellent.  5'2" tall, 138lbs, size 8 is a perfect fit.  These appear to run true to size, definitely not small.
review.name: Perfect Pants!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these pants. I am a forest technologist and it is so hard to find good durable pants for women that stand up to consistent bush work. My pants have lasted several years of rigorous use however they are starting wear out and pull apart at the seams. Things cannot last forever but am very impressed on the longevity of these pants. I would have given 5 stars however they have changed the fit of these pants. I ordered the same size to replace my old pants however the "improved fit" make them much to small and the size up are much too big. Very sad that there is such huge variation between the sizes now. I hear I am not the only the one that think the sizing is off now.... unfortunately I am forced to look elsewhere for durable hiking pants.
review.name: Bring Back the old fit!

review.reviewBody:
The sizing for these trousers is SO off. I am a UK size 8 waist 26 inches, with pretty minimal curves around my hips and thighs, so bought the small as per the size guide.

They’ve just arrived and I can barely sit down they are so tight, not just around my waist but only around my thighs???
review.name: Sizing off

review.reviewBody: great pants, the sizing is hard had to do a swap. but great customer service on the return/exchange!! hope it goes well.
review.name: great product: forever pants

review.reviewBody:
I purchased a size, 32-inch waist and a 39-inch-long. It fits me! I am 4’11” and I weigh 104 lb. The length is a bit long on me, but that can’t be helped. I cinch the leg opening so that they stay on my ankles. 

I have a ventilated pro I purchased in 2018. I wore that exclusively when I went hiking and camping, as well as urban prowling. But I wasn’t too happy with stretchy fabrics. Though making movements of legs and hips easier, they stretched out, pilled, and became raggedy looking. I wanted pants with all g-1000 that would last forever. The blue color is gorgeous and I love the high waist. The pockets, of course, are not only strategically placed and therefore highly functional but also somehow fashionable! I just wish that fjallraven considers offering petite sizings for all their clothes, especially pants.
review.name: Superb fabric and fit

review.reviewBody: I have had these pants for nearly 7 years, and these are absolutely the best field pants I have ever owned. I work in polar climates and have worn these in arctic Alaska and Antarctica. The Arctic summer is characterized by wet cold, and after applying a couple coats of Greenland wax, these easily shed sleet and mud and kept my knees dry when kneeling on tundra. In Antarctica, they stop the strong, icy wind from penetrating. I am a US size 6, and tried these in EU size 38 and 40. The 38's fit perfect, but I kept the 40's because I wanted to layer these over fleece pants. These pants do the same job that any water-resistant outer layer would do, but they are comfortable, far less bulky, and look way better.
review.name: Perfect

name: Vidda Pro Trouser - Women's

review.reviewBody: i purchased this shoe last year and using it for my trail running. its a very light weight and comfortable shoe. very easy to clean. dry within few minutes and still looks new
review.name: a very long lasting and comfortable shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought it by switching from my old sense 3, very comfortable and durable ! I am very satisfied
review.name: Great!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like this product, I bought a pair a few months ago in a store, now I'm about to buy my second pair in a different color
review.name: Great purchase

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These shoes have become my favorite pair of running shoes and I hope that you will continue to sell them. I’m a trail runner and IronMan. I’ve tried many different types of shoes but these are my go to  

The shoe laces, I don’t know what they are called are absolutely a game changer too. 

Please change nothing and continue to offer them in the future 

Job well done!!
review.name: I love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had Sense Ride 4, this one better than 4, run on trails and beach!
review.name: Great fit, lacing system smart!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable walking. Just learned about this trail runner category, although it's not as stable nor as agile as a hiker for e.g. on uneven terrain. Attractive colour schemes.
review.name: Non gore-tex nicer in summer

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Soles slip backwards constantly. Not a fan of the extra fabric compared to the SR4 - gives a clunky feel.
review.name: Downgrade from SR4

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 5 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The first few runs they were fantastic. Lots of toe room and great grip for the trails I run. They fit nice a securely and hold very well on tight corners. 

After a month of running ( about 60k because I alternate between trail and road with my road shoes ) the sole started moving backwards so that my front toe goes I to the little void it creates when doing so. This is the first time I’ve had a shoe do this. It’s too bad because I love everything else about these shoes.
review.name: Great show with one big problem

review.reviewBody: I haven’t found myself wishing I had a lower gear yet, even after a big backcountry ride around Reddish Knob in the George Washington National Forest, on the VA/WV border. Being able to replace the original 10-50t GX Eagle cassette on my 2018 Santa Cruz Blur with this open box special 10-52t for just over $100 was a huge relief. With a big family and a fleet of bikes to keep maintained, the deals I can get on Backcountry are really helpful.
review.name: Two more teeth make a big difference!

review.reviewBody:
This will be my second time using one of these cassettes. The old one lasted a good long, time so that is a huge plus, but the listed weight of 246g is waaaay off. I weighed it at home and it comes in at 401g. 

I’d probably buy it again for the longevity and price, but don’t think it’s a featherweight component.
review.name: Good, but incorrect weight

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boot in July in anticipation of my three week trip to the Dolomites in September. I have just returned. My wife and I averaged 6 miles a day and every day the boot actually felt better. Never experienced anything like that before.normally feet get tired of the same boot and I alternate but not these. I’m 66 and hiked all my life. Just a great boot.
review.name: Best boot ever

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these to use for light hiker’s/backup boots for spring turkey season. After reading the reviews, I upsized a 1/2 size and recommended and chose not to order a wide as I’ve got narrow feet, and running narrow was the most negative things I had read about these. They are perfect. The fit was absolutely spot on, they’re extremely lightweight and what I thought were going to be used for my backup boot have since been moved to the only boot I’ve worn all season. Highly recommend
review.name: Great Boot at a Great Price

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these as an alternative to the superb Salomon GTX4 boots that I've had for a few years. I wanted something a little lighter for occasions when I'm not carrying much (e.g. less than 35 lbs +). These La Sportiva boots seem to be just the ticket, but I can't speak to durability yet. The little hooks at the top make me uneasy... but we shall see. Speaking of laces, I wish they came with thicker laces; the included set is scrawny, but they work. 

The fit is good for me; I usually wear a 46 (in my everyday Ecco footwear of all sorts and the boots mentioned), so that's what I ordered despite some reviews warning that these run small. I do think they are a tad shorter and narrower than the Salomon GTX4, but they fit my feet well, and the smaller interior volume is compatible with my foot shape. I wear them with Smart wool (vintage, not the newer crummier kind) and other wool blend hiking socks. (The size label inside these boots say 12.5 US, but there's no way they are that big. 12 at most, in the opinion of this US resident.)

The sole is kind of interesting, because it seems to be pierced. Rather than just the traditional lugs/pokey bits like in a Vibram or what-have-you, this La Sportiva sole also features small lugs that are captive in the holes pierced in the outsole. They flex a good bit, and smaller debris can get caught in the space between these lugs and the holes containing them. I've not tromped through water with them yet, so don't know if that design quirk might be problematic for keeping feet dry. (I hope not!!) 

During break-in, the synthetic upper rearmost sleeve rubbed my achilles area to the point that it got sore, but that soreness and the rubbing disappeared after 20 miles of break-in hiking. 

I like these boots enough to contemplate bringing them along with the Salomon's on an upcoming trip to Switzerland, and deal with the extra space they will need in my luggage. For hikes without a pack, I think they would be first choice.
review.name: Lightweight support for rugged trails

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had the SYNTHETIC version for the last year. Used them almost everyday for all types of terrain. Hiking trails, rock scrambling, gnarly climbing approaches, dog walks, roofing jobs, etc. Love them. When one of our foster puppies chewed up the ankle support area I figured I'd order the leather version and give them a shot. They are not the same feeling and perform differently than the synthetic. Mainly the ankle support is a bit stiffer, which I don't prefer. May be better for some. They are also roomier or just slightly larger than the synthetic version. Which for a thicker socks going into winter will be good but they don't have the honed snug feeling the synthetic versions have for me. The leather are great just slightly different. Was going to exchange them but decided to keep them since they are warmer and it's going into winter. Hope that helps
review.name: Slightly different from synthetic versio

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of La Sportiva shoes/boots and I absolutely love them. I typically need to run 1/2 size smaller than most other brands but sizing has been consistent across all 3 pairs. I only have 1 hike in these so far so I cannot comment on longevity but they feel almost as light as my trail runners. I'm mostly a day hiker who runs light and only carries what can fit in pockets and these have been the perfect shoe for my application.
review.name: Perfect lightweight boot for slim feet

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Takes a lot for me to go back and write a review. Bought these kept in closet then took on monster 3 wk vaca no break in period. Took on day hike 9,5 miles great wx. felt great.
Then i put 39 miles on them in 2 days . 25.2 on a TH -TH attempt on Granite peak in MT> in one day.. Solid goretex no wet feet. Then Again in the Wind River range on a 4 night 5 day 50 mile hike got no complaints... just lucky i bought them on fathers day when they were on sale... :)
review.name: I can't say enough

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Service.  Backcountry’s service is really good.   My initial order was too small and complicated by my ineptitude.   Throughout the process, at each obstacle I threw up, the Backcountry team immediately found an answer.  Normally, when things don’t go my way I move on.  Fortunately, with the Backcountry team issues are resolved so quickly and seamlessly it’s hard to believe the problem ever occurred.  
If you want quality technical gear, rest assured Backcountry will ensure you have the right product for your needs.  Talk to their Gearheads, they don’t disappoint.
review.name: This is why I like Backcountry

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is good boots. Fairly light, nice fit, good ankle support, rad look. They run small a little bit. My regular for many brands is 11 US, this boots in 11.5 fit perfectly.
review.name: Light and supportive, size up a half

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Yes, both men's and women's versions run small, but the men's run a smidge small whereas the women's version runs really small.  The men's Ultra Raptor II mid leather GTX fits my foot like a hugging slipper.  I wear a 9 in other boots, bought a 9, and yes they hug my feet, but they aren't uncomfortable or poking, which is the important thing.  Being a leather upper, I find that a snug slipper feeling is good because the leather will stretch.  Out of the box, they are extremely comfortable and light.  I like the integrated heel gaiter which helps if you don't want to fuss with a regular gaiter in the summer. the soles are sticky, very sticky.  No hot spots and no issues.  Glad La Sportiva came out with leather upper version.
review.name: All around great hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots in us size 11.5, I normally wear us size 10.5 wanted to try a bigger boot. These boots are extremely narrow, and my toes were touching the front! I would have loved them to fit! they would be excellent if you can get a size that fits! With the return charge for shipping, I will no longer be purchasing from Backcountry.
review.name: EXTREMELY TIGHT AND SMALL

name: Ultra Raptor II Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love this bag for the size and weight. It is nice there are two interior compartments and two outer ones for smaller items. I do find myself wishing there was one on the back of the pack for a secure space next to my body. Other reviews mentioned the carrying strap discomfort. I don’t have lots of “padding” on my shoulders so the ropes do bite after wearing for long periods of time. This bag does what it is designed to do and is well made.
review.name: Nice pack

review.reviewBody: One year later after purchase....stil the BEST bag I've ever had. This is a handy accesory for those of us who like to do life without constantly carrying something. I love that this bag is hands-free, durable, and can be used for anything--purse, shopping, hiking, etc. I ama BIG fan and a KAVU convert!
review.name: My most used item ever

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’3 155lbs waist 29 hips 42, I got a medium and although I have to do a little shimmy to get the waistband up on it fits great otherwise. A large would've been too big. Fits exactly like it does on the models (wondery IG) where you can see the shorts always. I love the pale blue color. Can’t wait to use it on the trails. I do wish it had a UPF addition.

My one criticism (one that I've found with most skorts) is that the athletic shorts underneath are a little too short to make it comfortable to do long hikes in without chaffing.

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 5'9". I ordered AUTUMN LEAF-DARK NAVY Size S but it is way too long (2 inches too long on my sleeves). They ran out of XS for the color. Otherwise, I love this flannel shirt.
review.name: 2 inches too long even for size S

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: First, my physical dimensions because reviews are most relevant to readers when you include them. I’m 6’ (182.9 cm), 175-180 lbs (81.6 kg), with an athletic, muscular build and I ordered size medium in the Dark Sand color and Autumn Leaf color. The shirts are made from the quality fabric and construction one expects from Fjallraven, however they are not “heavy” as claimed in the model name—they are instead middle weight. Heavyweight flannel fabric should be a minimum of 8 oz (227 grams) per sq. yard. I have a Filson flannel made with fabric of the above specs and it feels like a light blanket, much more substantial than the Singi “heavy” flannel. Though not the thickness I was expecting, mid-weight flannels have a place in the wardrobe and these look and feel great so I’ll be keeping them. Well, mostly keeping them; I might exchange the Dark Sand one for a replacement of the same color to hopefully resolve an apparent fabrication discrepancy. Strangely the Autumn Leaf fit was perfect in all dimensions, but the Dark Sand was a little shorter, on the cusp of too short, but not quite, and a little boxier around the waist. Perhaps the Autumn color-way is Fjallraven’s new “improved” fit and the Sand color shirt that I received is from a batch of the original design. I like my flannels to have enough room for a t-shirt or lightweight, long-sleeved base layer but no more than that, as I prefer a physique accentuating fit. Though these are claimed to be regular fit and not slim fit they appear slightly fitted on my body though not as fitted as the Fjallraven Skog. I also own a Skog flannel in size large and the medium Singi fits similarly to it. I don’t think I’ll be able to wash these shirts in any water temperature other than cold and they definitely will never see the inside of a dryer as they fit exactly right now and have zero margin for shrinkage. If you like to launder your stuff in hot water and dry everything in the dryer then you might consider sizing up if your stats are similar to mine, same if you prefer a roomier fit. They’re solid shirts that enhance sex appeal, and aside from the slight sizing inconsistency between color-ways I’m mostly satisfied with the purchase.
review.name: Solid quality shirt not what I expected

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the shirts, they feel great and fit perfect as new but having owned 3, including two recent purchases, they can’t be washed without shrinking. I’ve followed the instructions to the letter.  When I bought the shirts I shared my concern with the retailer as my first shirt shrank so badly,their advice was to wear a T shirt and not was them.
review.name: Nice shirt, doesn’t wash well.

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I usually don't take the time, or care to write down reviews. 
I got the orange-autumn coloured one last year and it's SO great. I can't wait for colder days so I can wear this again all the time. Very comfortable, nice and warm.
review.name: Excelent flannel

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: i picked this up with hopes that it could be one of my regular daylies this past winter. well made, midweight, and true to size. i will get another season or two out of it which is rare based on past purchases of similar brands.
review.name: a fine flannel

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worn this shirt a few times so far and like it more each time. Feels durable but comfortable. They really paid attention to the details. Fits the way I expected it to. I will get more.
review.name: great shirt

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
For a $110 "heavy" flannel, this shirt doesn't cut it. An 8.5 oz/300gsm flannel is heavy weight. This isn't it. It's just a tad beefier than a mid-weight. It doesn't have the brushed softness that comes with a premium priced flannel. I've had this for 4 months and have probably worn it less than 20 times for low-intensity activity and already some of the thread at the front has come loosened or pilled. The front check pockets have started to curl too. I have not stuck it in the dryer since I've started wearing it. The roll-up sleeve options with the stays is a nice idea but is rendered useless if you can't bend your arms; it's too tight and restrictive.

I see this flannel as being for office casual and cut for slim. Other than the restrictive arms when rolled-up, I like the fit. But in scared to put it in the dryer.

Overall, the quality and cut is not worth the price. Not what I expected from my first purchase of a fjallraven product. I do like the patterns though.
review.name: Not heavyweight

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I actually really like the material (thick soft cotton), but the shirt doesn't fit. Ordered a Large (like my other Fjallraven shirts) and this one sits right at the top of my belt, I'm 5'10" and 210. It shrunk after washing, seemed to fit before. I'll gift it to someone a little smaller than me.
review.name: Order a size up, nice material

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am a male, 5'7"- 36"  chest, 130 lbs. I bought the Men's Small in Deep Forest. I love the softness of this well made shirt as well as the heftier feel to the fabric, sturdy without the bulk. I get so many compliments on the style and the Deep Forest colour, a very handsome addition to my growing Fjallraven collection.
review.name: A Stellar Shirt

review.itemreviewed: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this shirt! It?s my go-to once Fall comes around. Looks great and the quality beats out every other shirt I own. Modern fit with a classic look. This will probably last me 20 years!
review.name: Great fit and construction, classic!

name: Singi Heavy Regular Fit Flannel Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
How about these to replace a pair of Arters ski pants that were about six seasons old. These are awesome. Great fit, very rugged and all the room I need in the pockets to store gear. They are a little bit wide in the legs, but I like that for flexibility. Generally true size.
Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: The quality and material seems great, but the size large seems like it is made for a rhinoceros. The length and waist are fine for me ( 6'1" 185 lb), but the width of the legs are like 90s JNCO jeans. They are just way too wide even for casual pants let alone high-performance outdoor gear. Had to return them.
review.name: Size large does not fit a human being

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these ski pants. I ordered a L and XL. I am 6’3”, 195 lb, I will admit to a slight dad-paunch, but not a big gut. The L would have fit when I was a slim 180-185 lb. The XL were better through the waist and butt, but were comically baggy through the leg. Someone else said there was enough material to put two legs on each side - rings true. I just couldn’t picture skiing in them with the pants legs rubbing on each other constantly. Regrettably returned both pair.
review.name: Could not make them fit

review.reviewBody: I've been tired of lightweight fabrics that tear easily and so far I'm extremely happy with this Lofoten pants. The tough gore-tex pro fabric with extra large, full wrap around scuff guards are going to survive my backcountry excursions much longer than my last 2 pairs of pants. I'll take a little extra weight for durability at this point. The full leg side zips shed heat extremely well during hot spring skinning. The front pockets are big and strangely help with warmth during wet/cold days on the lifts. The buttons that give multiple options for cuff sizing are a great little feature; one is setup for large ski boots, the next smaller helps keep your pants from hitting the ground when wearing tennis shoes. The one little problem is the zipper along the waist band (that must connect it to a corresponding jacket)... I did not notice this feature in the description and the zipper does cause some chaffing when I'm wearing a large pack for over night ski trips. I've just cut it off so it doesn't bother me anymore.
review.name: Simple, well designed, tough pants

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody:
So first, the normal thing I get with Norrona being 5'7 and 185lbs. These pants are definitely made for a thin slightly taller build. I fit the mediums in waist(32 waist) but the length should be about 4inches shorter... I think this exacerbates the real reason I am returning them, which is how big and baggy these felt. There is definitely enough material to put both legs in one leg sleeve :D. 
But on the positive, exceptional build quality, awesome leg zippers and great pockets I think really lead to a pant that for someone a little taller than me would be a perfect pant. I love everything else I have from Norrona.
review.name: Perfect pants(out of box)... A bit baggy

review.reviewBody:
These were great pants which I feel like were almost there. I loved the pocket locations on the leg instead of the hip. Made it super easy to quickly grab snacks on the chair lift when sitting down. Almost loved the mini key/pass pocket in the upper left of the pant which prevent anything important from accidentally falling out when accessing my other pockets. I also loved the full length zipper on both legs. This made it super easy to dump heat along the full leg instead. The material feels super durable as well, but still allowed for plenty of movement. 

Now onto the sizing... I am 6'0", about 195lbs, and usually wear 34-36x32 jeans. I ordered the Large in these pants. The sizing was weird. Around the belt and in the seat area I thought the pants felt decent. For this I would say true to size. The legs were massive though. They reminded me of parachute pants. This made it a tiny bit annoying when needing to adjust my boot buckles since the pants covered all of them except my toe buckle. I was able to fix this a tiny bit by adjust the snaps around cuff on the leg.
#Backcountry Gearhead
review.name: Great pant which is almost there

review.reviewBody: I am 6’0”, 200lbs with a 33-34” waist and 35” inseam.   I bought large.   They were huge!  Waist, seat and length all way too big.  I always wear large pants.  I exchanged for M.   Couldn’t even come close to zipping them up.   2” plus too small in waist.   A little too tight seat and length.   Not sure why the massive difference in size.   If I don’t know better I woulda guessed  I was in the XL to start.
review.name: Bizarre sizing!

review.reviewBody: Granite, sharp branches, bushwhacking manzanita, mega beaters, these pants deflect it all and the Gore-Tex lasts.  I even slid the better part of an S-rail on my hip, any pant I've ever owned would melt right through from the friction, these pants didn't even show a scuff.  I like my pants a little long, by year's end the bottoms have usually been stepped on and shredded, once again, the reenforced cuff has held up strong.  All this sounds great, but what else is important is that they look good too.  Great fit, super comfortable, I find myself wearing them long after the day has ended.  Inbounds and in the backcountry my go to pant.
review.name: Don't Show Any Wear

review.reviewBody: Love them! They run a bit big. Really wish you would bring back the black ones.
review.name: Some of My Favorite Shorts

review.reviewBody: I really love these shorts.  Perfect everyday outfit in Florida.  Especially comfortable for bending and lifting. A little bit pricey, but if you want to be comfortable and look pretty sharp while you're at it - just splurge and buy these.
review.name: These will be your go-to shorts

review.reviewBody: Very strange fit and not comfortable. Go back to the drawing board on these.
review.name: Strange fit, not comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts!! Size was perfect - love the drawstring so I didn't need a belt.  Wore them for a sailing trip and will certainly be using them on all of my fishing adventures!
review.name: The Best Shorts!

review.reviewBody: Boat shorts, swim trunks, or for a night out. Look great, wash stains out well, and don’t wrinkle on travel. Have a few pair and go everywhere with me. The rubber logo looks great above the pocket. Favorite pair of shorts I own!
review.name: The Best Shorts

review.reviewBody: I have multiple pairs of the old guide shorts, they have a sewn on front button that can't be felt next to you belly skin, just got a new pair and now the front fastener is a metal river that the inside next to your belly, the edges are sharp and cut into your belly! I don't like this design change. They are less comfortable due to this but ...... I do like pocket changes and the fit is better.
review.name: The button is uncomfortable and sharp against your belly skin

review.reviewBody: Amazing shorts! Very comfortable, breathable, fast-drying, and look great. Liked them so much I ordered the other colors. And I would keep buying any new colors.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: Fit great, performance is outstanding. These are my number 1 choice on the boat now
review.name: Great Overall

review.reviewBody: Very nice shorts. Super comfortable, stretchy and the draw string was an added bonus... No belt needed for my aways changing waistline. :)
review.name: Comfort with style

review.reviewBody: These shorts are very durable and well thought out! I do like the drawstring so you can wear without a belt if you do want to swim in them.  One big thing is the front pockets are deep, so if you are sitting in a canoe your phone or other items don’t the run the risk of falling out.  Big fan of these.
review.name: Great shorts!

hasVariant.name: Quasar 3D Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Quasar 3D Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I couldn’t have been happier with this purchase for my recent backpacking trip. The pad is so thick and also very lightweight. I slept great!
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: My order turned out to be fully functional but it is just not wide enough for me. I am going to need to get a new mattress pad that is wider. It's a shame that I am past the returns date, otherwise I would have gladly exchanged. Used it 2 times before I decided it was just too thin side to side
review.name: Need a bigger size

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, keeps you off the ground, long enough (but in only 5'6"), but NOT wide enough. I invariably fall off one side or the other.
review.name: Regular too narrow
comment: Thanks for leaving a review! Happy to say the Quasar™ 3D Sleeping Pad also comes in a regular wide size and a long wide size.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and easy to inflate. Well worth the purchase
review.name: Really nice

review.reviewBody: The mattress itself is very nice.  Used on the famous RAGBRAI bicycle adventure in Iowa and slept well.  The accompanying filler bag was useless.  Popped on the second, literally, second bag full of air.  Bring an electric or pedal pump.
review.name: NEBO 3D Sleeping bag

review.reviewBody:
Wow we have come a long way from foam sleeping pads for those who want comfort and need to carry light. This is a great sleeping pad. I’m not light, but it holds me well and I don’t bottom out. I love the options for size and insulation. Went with the wide non-insulated. Im bike touring Nova Scotia and so far it’s been a great choice. 
A few things I’d like: more curvature on the sides for us side sleepers. There’s some but more would be better. And to be very fussy, I’d like to chose what side to inflate it from.
review.name: Happy Camper.

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this pad - I'm reviewing the Long / Insulated version.  I really can't say enough about it... super comfortable, quiet, and no more slipping off the pad.  I've slowly been refining my camping sleep rig.. and this is the finishing touch!  WELL DONE NEMO!!
review.name: WOW!!!

review.reviewBody: Have only used the pad 6-7 times so far but there are several pros. Super easy to inflate, holds air overnight even in chilly temps, and packs away very nicely.
review.name: Great pad!

review.reviewBody:
This is hands-down the most comfortable sleeping pad I’ve ever owned or laid down on. The 3D contouring of the pad does contribute noticeably to comfort, and is thoughtfully designed. There are slightly larger baffles to lay your head on, while a shallow depression in the torso/hip area keeps you centered on the pad. Towards the foot end the contouring flattens out, presumably to let your feet fall wherever is most comfortable. Included pump sack takes a bit of practice but functions well and is a nice touch. The storage sack for the pad includes a mini repair kit too. 
So, how’s it sleep? Coming from other pads, I tended to inflate this one pretty firm, and while it was still more comfy than the average pad, it wasn’t the cloud dream I hoped for. The magic happens when you use the micro-adjust valve to deflate this thing just a little bit (while you’re laying on it!) until you can feel your whole body sink into it slightly. At that point, prepare for the best night of sleep you’ve ever had on an uneven, rocky patch of ground. 
A few more notes: 
-this pad isn’t too noisy! Don’t expect utter silence, but it is significantly quieter than other ultralight air pads I’ve had. 
-the material is quite soft on your skin, and I’d be happy sleeping on it without a pillow, but this soft material also seems difficult to clean and prone to absorbing things like oils. Over time I’m curious how dirty this top fabric might get; for now I make sure to use a pillow or cover the head baffles with a camping towel. 
-I purchased the WIDE version of this pad, and I’m glad I did (it’s so roomy!), but note that most “2-person” backpacking tents will NOT accommodate two wide pads. Prepare to feel like terrible sleeping partner when you realize your mat takes up 70% of the tent floor space.
review.name: Superb comfort that fits in any pack

review.reviewBody: Recently used on 5-night AT section hike. Slept like I would at home. When awakened would have to remind myself I was not in my own bed.
review.name: Envy of all my trailmates!

name: Quasar 3D Sleeping Pad
