hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Slickrock Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Hips: 45” waist: 32”, got the XL. 5’9, plenty of inseam. Loose fit in the waist, fits in the seat, but does NOT fit my thighs. The ankle zipper is useless because it only opens 1”, and won’t allow me to get the pants over my knee to get knee pads on. I can fit my slim knee pads under but it’s tight, and the big knee pads have to go over. With the tight fit in the thigh, the seam that goes around the thigh just above the knee is weird and awkward — it looks bad once you start layering.  

Note to pattern makers: please update your XL model/design guidelines to allow more ease through the legs. Bigger girls have bigger legs, not just a bigger waist. 

Undecided if I will return yet, but these will be backups, not primaries, if I keep.
review.name: Curvy Girls Take Note!

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love the slick rock pants. Ultimately, after a hard decision, I did send them back. And this is why:  the fabric is fairly thin, I ordered the gray and it was more light blue and it didn’t have a thigh pocket for my phone.
review.name: Wasn’t quite what a expected

review.reviewBody:
These pants survived a crash on rocks that destroyed my shirt but not my slickrock pants! 
11/10 every mountain biker should have these.
review.name: Crash tested and approved

review.reviewBody:
I picked these pants up towards the end of Summer/Fall 2023 and they have been a staple in my outdoor activities ever since. They are without a doubt my go-to pair of pants for a variety of activities, not just for biking.

Some features that I really appreciate:
1. They are lightweight, perfect for those warmer days (65° and above). I haven't tested them in the heat of summer yet, but they held up great on a hot 90° day while backpacking in the Grand Canyon. I have put long underwear on while wearing these, but I don’t love doing high cardio activities in long underwear, so I switch to my Dharco MTB pants for colder weather. 
2. The side vents are a game changer for me. While I wish they were a bit bigger, they still provide a nice breeze while riding or hiking if the wind is blowing. (Hey Backcountry, maybe consider making bigger side vents in the future?) I love using the vent slits to store my phone when biking with chamois that have a side pocket (Dharco makes the best chamois that have this feature).
3. These pants are incredibly comfortable. I can easily wear knee pads underneath, squat, pedal, hike, and even lounge around. They have been my go-to on hot days for just hanging out. Especially as someone who is obsessed with sun protection. 
4. They offer great rain resistance and dry super fast when soaked. I put them to the test on a five-day backpacking trip on the Lost Coast during two days of straight rain. They got soaked where my rain skirt didn't cover, but dried out quickly.
5. Sun protection. I am pretty principled about my sun protection and I won’t ride in shorts or short sleeves. So these have been the best option for my sun protection obsession. 
6. They have not stretched out. I wore these on a backpacking trip for 6 days straight. With soaking rain. Not once did they stretch out. To this day they still fit great. 

A few downsides to note:
1. I struggle to access my knee pads while wearing these pants, but I have the same issue with all my MTB pants.
2. The belt strap doesn't stay in place very well. So it won’t help if they are large around the waist. 
3. The front pockets aren't very practical while riding, as they are in an awkward position for storage. 

I am 5’6” and fluctuate between 115 and 120 pounds and I am quite slim. My pants size is between a 24-25 or 0-4 and the small fits wonderful, with and without chamois. (In Lululemon I wear a size 2 or 4 in their pants)
review.name: Best Outdoors Pants

review.reviewBody:
I get compliments any time I wear these pants on the trails! I live in texas and we have some pretty rugged terrain and brush usually around the trails so having a super breathable and light weight pant to help keep the sun off my legs and also provide protection against some branches and prickly plants is awesome! I bought a size small, I'm 5'4" and fluxuate from 128 - 132lbs since having my little boy last year. 

I ABSOLUTELY love the fit, theres enough room in the waist so they dont cut you in half when leaning over I wear a padded short with these and you can hardly tell but fit seamlessly together. The only gripe i have with these pants is where the vent zips are on the outter thigh there is a part of the zipper fabric that itches me if I dont wear a shammie/ padded shorts. Its quiet irritating but I'm super sensitive to itchy fabrics so it may just be me or I might of gotten a faulty pair. Regardless, I wear these 9/10 any time I'm getting on my MTB. I love them so much and will be buying more colors in these and will also try the 5" shorts this summer as well because im not a long short gal. Hope to see you out on the trails!
review.name: My favorite MTB pant hands down.

review.reviewBody:
I first purchased the Slickrock bike short and was so in love, I just had to try the pants… skeptically though, a pant for mountain biking???
After one sunny, but still chilly spring ride, I am in love with the pants as much as I am with the shorts!
Perfectly designed with the features you’d want from a pant and a great fit! I am 5’10” / 190 lbs, up 15# heavier/curvier than I normally am, (but still taller than wider by a long shot) and typically a size 14, the XL fits very well. The waist doesn’t cut in at all (yay, who likes to feel like they are being squeezed in 2 by their waistband or have unattractive rolls above your pants???), they fall at my ankle and were large enough in the leg that I never felt a frustrating pull or stretch in the material, but they aren’t loose enough where I was worried about the chain, I know… they sound like magic pants and they may be!
If you want a pant that can work for mountain biking, jogging, hiking, grocery shopping, whatever… on a day with a brisk wind where you want protection, but not insulation, and a quick drying pant, this is the pant for you.
review.name: Awesome design & fit!

review.reviewBody: I didn’t want to spend a ton on a pair of MTB pants. Got these on sale and am very happy with them! Only complaint is that they are a little baggy around the ankles— if your short. Certainly not a deal breaker though for half the price of other MTB pant brands.
review.name: 5’ 3”   140 lb  bought size M

review.reviewBody: I read to "size up" on several of the reviews and in the item details. I bought a size small and they were too big. They were too big in every aspect, the hips the butt the legs the waist. I returned for an XS and they fit great. They are light weight and comfortable. I LOVE the high rise waist because I don't like low rise and I haven't since the mid 2000's when it was in style and I don't like riding a MTB with my navel out or my lower back getting sunburnt or mud all over. I'm barely 5'2 and about 110 lbs or so. I also love the movement of the fabric the 4 way stretch is fantastic and makes them so comfy. I hope they offer more colors soon!
review.name: love!

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants and love riding in them, but what happened to including a pocket for my cell phone? If you need to keep the leg vents, you could move them or put a mesh pocket inside to hold a phone. I hope to buy another pair in the future with more usable pockets!
review.name: Great, but...

review.reviewBody: I’m petite and was happy these more or less fit. The waist does run small and extremely high on the torso. For the price, I was pretty disappointed that the stitching on one of the  knees is already torn/coming apart after only wearing them for two rides. The backcountry logo was also peeling off prior to even washing them. All in all, they serve their purpose.
review.name: Waist runs small

name: Slickrock Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: TL;DR: boots are quite wide, but low profile, and have very little cushion in the midsole at the ball of the foot. Not as good as the women's model. I bought the men's Grandview since the women's model is just barely wide enough for my foot and I wanted just a hair more volume in the boot. The men's boot is absolutely has more width, but the boot feels like they took the same amount of fabric for the upper and just put it on a wider base, resulting in a lower profile fit that wants to crush my foot flat. Worse though is that the midsole is very hard specifically at the ball of the foot, which is not the case on the women's. I tried using the insoles out of my other pair of Grandviews with no change in the comfort just walking around the house and outside; I can not imagine how painful these would be on an actual hike. It is very rare that I say this, but the women's boot is actually a better design on this shoe, even with the slight fit issues I have with it. I don't understand how this boot is so much worse in the mens fit. I will be returning these and continuing the hunt for a boot that actually fits my foot right
review.name: Wide but low profile and hard midsole

review.reviewBody: I thought they were all leather, I can see why the use of other materials around the toe. All in all a good shoe!
review.name: Durable and comfortable

review.reviewBody: When I first discovered these boots, I felt as if they were designed just for me. I wanted ankle support in a lightweight, comfortable boot that was wide enough in the front so my toes were not cramped. Got it! I am often asked about them by friends and strangers. I wear them everywhere, not just for hiking.
review.name: This is my third pair. I wear them everywhere.

review.reviewBody: I really like this boot. It fits well, keeps my feet dry and does not make my toes sweat. I hope the design does not get changed as I plan to keep buying this one as needed.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: I had my pair of Grandview GTX for just shy of one year and the tread lugs separated from the sole. Yes! They are two different materials and not one solid piece of poly or rubber. The stitching  on the side has also blown out. I contacted Teva and sent the boots in but they rejected my claim because their manufacturing dates was older than my purchase date; less than one year. You need to do better, Teva, on standing behind your products, manufacturing defects and customer service.
review.name: This hiker is junk

review.reviewBody: I have had these hikers for all of two days now and cannot say that I like them. The lace eyelet in the tongue is a stupid idea. Makes it hard to pull laces snug after managing to get my foot into the shoe (not exactly easy since the heel pull-up loop is non-existent!). As sold, the laces are skinny and much too short to make a decent tie. Next, the LEFT boot has the metal eyelet pushing against my arch......very uncomfortable! There is no interior padding to stop this. On a positive note: The sizing is true and the wider toe box is a welcome improvement. I have found very little "slop" inside the boot and my heel stays put. Now if only the heel loop was there.....
review.name: Not quite as pictured

review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace my Ridgeviews which had fit perfectly in the same size but had fallen apart after a year of use. These are much more snug on the sides of my feet. I thought they just needed to be broken but no luck. I now wear them without the insoles to get more space. I may just donate them. I wish I would have stuck with the Ridgeviews. I thought I was upgrading. My fault for not getting the right size. But still frustrating.
review.name: Sized differently than Ridgeview

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and comfort. Love the color and weight of these boots. Tread is awesome so far. I wouldn't change a thing.
review.name: I love these boots!

review.reviewBody: Exceeded my expectations, a little bit wider in the toe than my typical shoes but I love the change and extra room!!
review.name: Super comfy right out of the box

review.reviewBody: I've had many hiking/work boots over the years! These Teva are by far my favorite! So much so immediately bought a second pair!! These boots are the most comfortable boots I've ever worn!! Highly recommend!!
review.name: Great Boot!!!

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket.  

1. Its buttery soft-  its seriously one of the softnest jackets I have worn.  really nice feel!
2. Warm without bulk- this jackets packs tons of warmth but does not come with the bulk.  I have worn by itself and used as a layering piece.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is ruined and it didn't even get worn outside of trying it on once. I noticed a little dark spot on the jacket and assumed it was probably just a spot from being handled in a warehouse. I tried to gently wipe it off with water and the fabric started rubbing off in the area where the spot was and it began pilling. Upon closer inspection, the spot was actually an area with much thinner, transparent fabric that will inevitably become a hole. I don't want to deal with the hassle of returning and ordering again hoping for better quality. It is such a cute jacket, I am pretty disappointed in the fabric though.
review.name: Defect

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of the stretchstone and trekkin flannels that were the precursors to this. Both of the shirts I ordered were much shorter in the hem relative to the length of the cuff than shown in the pictures and compared to the stretchstone and trekkin shirts of the same size. The bottom of the shirt sits a full 3 inches higher than the bottom of the cuffs which is much different than the other Mountain Hardware shirts. It looks like I'm wearing a womens shirt with orangutan arms.  I'm 5'10 and a fairly skinny 155# the size small was a nice athletic fit. I would have kept them if the hem of the shirt was a couple of inches longer.
review.name: Kind of a crop top

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Sportlite 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sportlite 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Sportlite 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Purchased: Aug 2024

Uses: 15+ day hikes with scrambling in the eastern Sierra

General: I purchased the Sportlite 30 to replace my aging, 11 year old, Deuter Speedlite 30. My preference is a balance of lightweight, volume, and comfort, and I had not seen anything comparable to my Speedlite until I saw the Osprey. Having used it for a few months, I feel I can give a run down of my impressions.

Fit: I have a 16” torso and purchased the small which fits very well. It carries much better than my Speedlite as it stays in place on my back better and there is less play when scrambling. 

What I like: Stretch side panels keep items secure, as does the front stretch compression pocket. I am very pleased Osprey added 2 hip pockets and I like that one of them is a stretch mesh pocket. I’ve always had zippered pockets in the past, and the stretch mesh secures a snack and allows for an easier retrieval than fighting with a zipper. I wasn’t sure I was going to like the direct access hydration sleeve, but it has worked well. Although the shoulder straps seem thin, they are comfortable and I’ve had no issues with them. 

What could be better: The 2 stretch loops on the shoulder straps are too high. I have a carabiner attached to the lower loop and it sits on top of my shoulder and sticks out rather than hanging down. I’d really like to see these moved lower. The side stretch mess pockets are about an inch to high. It is very difficult to reach around to grab something, e.g., bottle of liquid fuel/electrolytes, and put it back. The front compression pocket is also a bit too high. I basically have to unclip the compression straps to grab something, e.g., gloves, hat, from the pocket. But, on the other hand, if the pocket were not as high, it might not hold as much. I'm not sold yet on the trekking pole loops. They seem small cumbersome. 
 When I've had to store my poles, I stuff them in a side pocket and secure them with the top compression straps. Lastly, I prefer my key clip to be in the external pocket of the top lid. At the end of a hike, when I’m tired and just want to get in my car, with the clip in the external pocket, all I have to do is unzip + unclip. The workflow to get to one’s keys in the under the lid pocket design requires one to undo 2 compression straps (2 clicks) + flip the lid + unzip the pocket + unclip. That’s 5 steps vs 2. 

Despite the above limitations, I really do like this pack, especially how it carries. It meets my requirements for being light, having a 30L volume, and being comfortable. I’m not sure of the durability yet.. the mesh panel on the back has already ripped.
review.name: Lightweight, Carries Well, Good Features

review.reviewBody: This bag is great! It has a lot of great features and is very adjustable to fit your preferences. The only downside to this bag is how the straps come in pretty close together at the top. It kind of rubs my neck. I’m sure it will go away after I “break it in” a bit more, but for now I will just have to wear something with a collar when using it.
review.name: Good Quality and Comfortable Fit

name: Sportlite 30L Backpack
Sportlite 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I almost didn't purchase these based on the other review saying they weren't wide shoes. I have very wide shoes and these have plenty of space. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Super Wide

review.reviewBody: I am very happy with these new road shoes. I am a competitive roadie with wide feet, and I have a very difficult time finding cycling shoes to fit right. Other brands that offer road shoes in the wide size are not really alll that wide (eg, Shimano sphyre).  These Lake shoes fit me beautifully, with enough room in the toe box but narrow enough in the heels to prevent the back of my foot from lifting up The BOA dials snug the shoes down nicely. Another great thing about Lake shoes is they're offered in half sizes, and in both wide and extra wide widths, so I was able to find the best fit rather easily.  I've used theses shoes on hard rides several times and they feel fantastic, with a very stiff sole and efficient transfer of energy to the pedals.  I bought the black model, which is actually more of a metallic gray-black color that I really like.
review.name: Lake CX302 Wide

review.reviewBody: Been looking to replace my Lake wide shoes I've been squeezing into for years.  Excited about an extra wide pair that may actually fit me. Nope these are considerably more narrow than what I have. Now I have to pay to return them.  Probably last time using backcountry who took my money and now charging to return.  And now the 20% member sale done at REI.
review.name: This is NOT a wide shoe!

name: CX302 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Had this bike for just over a week.  5 ride review.  ts suspension is much easier to set up than previous bike (Tallboy 4) but not as refined.  Assuming its going to be a lot easier to keep running because its less complex.  Parts on bike are all decent and close to what I would pick on custom build (Shimano/Fox).  170mm cranks also taking time to adjust to but 100% know its helping with pedal strikes.  Been using 175s for 30+ years.  Mine came with DT Swiss 370 rear hub. 
 Engagement not good but can be upgraded.   It also doesn't seem to "roll' great but maybe this improves as hub breaks in.  SLX brakes took much longer to bed than expected too.  To point I yanked pads assuming possibly resin.  They were metal but had strange, black coating.  Cleaned that and brakes worked much better.  I got the black one.  If it glances at dirt it looks dirty.  Kinda regret not going white.  This frame does flex a lot more than the Tallboy too but that's not all bad.   I am very happy with purchase.
review.name: 5 ride review

name: Element C50 XT Mountain Bike

hasVariant.description: Buy the Astral Loyak AC Water Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wore these in Costa Rica last year and absolutely perfect for hot weather and water adventures! Comfortable, flexible, and minimal. Drains well and dries quickly after fully submerging your feet. Also keeps it's grip so you won't slip, even when wet. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect Water Light Adventure Shoe aka Costa Rica!

review.reviewBody: I've purchased two pairs of this product over the past 4 years.  The first pair, the uppers began peeling.   I loved the shoes so I kept wearing them especially since they were expensive.    I wanted a new pair, and I noticed that they changed the material on the upper part of the shoe, so I purchased a new pair.   First, I was very unhappy with the switch to shoelaces.   They never, ever stay tied.  I have to double tie them.   The first pair I had, had elastic laces and were fantastic.     The biggest issue with my second pair was the fact that the bottoms became extremely slippery.  So slippery I could not wear them sailing anymore.    I put them in my closet to wear walking around and yesterday I pulled them out.   After a day of slipping and sliding on just about any surface, I checked to see what the warranty was like.   I filed a warranty claim today.   I'm curious to see how this is handled.    I really love the look of these shoes, they are high priced, and I thought that meant good quality but the 2 pairs I have purchased have been disappointing in different ways.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: The Loyak's were very comfortable and drained water quickly. I recently wore them on a 7 day backcountry canoe trip in the Boundary Waters of Minnesota, and while they worked well, I wished I had the Brewer's instead for the portages. The soles are very light and thin on the Loyak and while the grip was decent I could feel every rock and root branch I stepped on, feeling almost like being barefoot. I look forward to wearing these again out west on an upcoming Colorado River trip where the walking will be less and will be mostly on sand and slickrock. Like all of Astrals stuff, it's well made, is comfortable for all day wear, dried relatively quickly once out of the water but wasn't the right choice for my situation.
review.name: Great shoe for the right situation

review.reviewBody: Such good looking comfortable shoes!  I don't even go hiking or any such thing but wear them out n about in the city. Just love them, I have two pairs.
review.name: Good Looking

review.reviewBody: The sizing is very on point, the comfort is great and I am very pleased with these shoes! I wear them around town, hiking, going to the gym.. wherever I wear them, they have certainly served their purpose.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody:
Sneaker is Phenomenal!
This is my 5th pair (3 navy, grey, black).  I've had Avia, Nike, Merrill--all good, but these are just so comfortable.  Walked hiking trails this past year, averaging 9mi/day for 17 days and never, ever felt tired or achy nor sweaty with temps in hi 80s...felt like slippers.
review.name: Comfort, comfort and comfort!

review.reviewBody: Wicked awesome shoes. Definitely worth it if you're always on the water.
review.name: Lovely

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable and look great. I actually bought these for work, (I bartend), which Astrals are perfect for - comfort, non-slip soles, quick drying. My only issue with the Loyak AC model is that the mesh is completely see through. Seeing my toes in a non-water setting is unnerving, so I need to add socks into the mix. That said - perfect for what they‚Äôre designed for (water) but not quite street ready without socks getting involved.
review.name: (Almost) Perfect

review.reviewBody: I love my Loyak AC water shoes. I wear them for all my favorite river recreational activities including snorkeling, rafting, swimming, fishing, kayaking, and so much more. These are the best water shoes money can buy. The Astral Designs team even sent me a free pair of insoles after I mysteriously lost one of mine. Great company, great products!
review.name: Perfect For Life on the River

review.reviewBody: The Astral Loyak AC is cute, and is the best performing and most comfortable water shoe Ive found for paddle boarding. As a former exercise physiologist, an ultra runner and massage therapist, I make sure I always have the best shoe for my sport, feet and body for the long haul. My husband loves his mens Loyaks and life vest. Astral Designs makes great gear for the water and is a company that will treat you right.
review.name: Best SUP Shoe, Awesome Company

name: Loyak AC Water Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: straps are sewn on and not adjustable. I bought 2 of this shoe, same size, different colors. The others fit perfectly. These are too big across my foot. If only the straps were adjustable. Othewise they feel like Teva. First time I've been disappointed in this brand.

review.reviewBody: I've waited for years for a slide like you used to make with a Velcro closure on top so it could be adjusted to my foot. review.reviewBody: My feet fit length wise but the width is too wide and only have about 1/2 centimeter available to adjust the Velcro strap tighter. If I were to buy a smaller size to fit my foot width then The length would be too small.

review.itemreviewed: SB120 T3 X01 Eagle AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: I expected my SB120 to come with a torque wrench kit and shock pump, which it didn't. I requested help from Backcountry and my email was ignored. I wish my bike came with better customer support.
review.name: Missing Items
comment: Thank you for your feedback. I understand how disappointing it is not to receive the torque wrench kit and shock pump with your SB120, and I'm sorry your email went unanswered. We’re committed to improving our service, and I’ve reached out via email to resolve this for you. Your satisfaction is important to us!

review.itemreviewed: SB120 T3 X01 Eagle AXS Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: Having a great time here in South Florida shredding our single track trails.
review.name: SB120 is an awesome ride

name: SB120 T3 X01 Eagle AXS Mountain Bike

description: Buy the Packtowl Changing Poncho online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Changing Poncho
hasVariant.description: Buy the Packtowl Changing Poncho online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Such a simple but useful product. Now use it all the time changing after bike rides, at beach, trailheads, etc.
review.name: Such a simple but useful

review.reviewBody: I'm finding even more ways to use it, and it makes a wonderful gift!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my girlfriend so she can change after rides. Great product, now I need one!
review.name: Way better than an old towel!

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for to take camping, hiking, and on photo shoots.  Love the length versatility.  I ordered a 14.  I do 12-14 in sizing and this has plenty of stretch.  I probably could have done a 12.  Hoping it holds up  as well as expected.
review.name: Excellent Quality

review.reviewBody: Love this light weight poncho for surfing in the PNW! I had a cotton towel changing poncho before this and it would never dry out from damp conditions. This poncho changed the game with it's quick dry material.
review.name: Love this light weight poncho

review.reviewBody: Great for road side changing after surfing or kayaking! Button shirts are easier to put on than T shirts under the poncho.
review.name: Great for road side changing

review.reviewBody: I use this poncho after freediving (or any other water activity) here on Oahu and love how long and roomy it is. I always get compliments on the pattern I bought (retro curve). It's absorbent, but not so much that you are walking around in a heavy wet towel. Considering the humidity, it dries very quickly here. I have other ponchos that are a cotton blend, which are also cozy, but take forever to dry and this one packs down so much smaller and more neatly that it's perfect for traveling when you have limited space in your luggage. I did notice that it felt stiff when brand new but that went away after washing it for the first time. The fabric is super soft and feels nice against the skin. I've also worn it at the beach when I need a bit of wind protection and it does a good job with that as well. Love the oversized hood. Ample space in the front pocket for your phone, keys, snacks, etc. Can't think of anything I don't like about it.
review.name: Perfect for freediving

name: Changing Poncho

description: Buy the Kakadu Sundowner Swag Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sundowner Swag Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kakadu Sundowner Swag Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This swag was really comfy to sleep in! Definitely no other ground tent comes near its comfort and convenience form. I was able to roll this swag back into its caring bag with two pillows and three sleeping bags kept within it. Only issue was the footprint. It’s a big footprint to be throwing this on a roof rack. I’d recommend a hitch carrier basket or a bed truck to haul it to a camp site.
review.name: Beware of footprint

name: Sundowner Swag Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.name: Mountain Bandit Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Mountain Bandit Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ditching a bag that looks like a ballsack and replacing it with this was a no brainer. Screws right into the saddle itself, doesn't have to be a mtn bike saddle, but rather any Specialized saddle that is SWAT compatible. I replaced the air tool holder with a small multi-tool instead. Only space for 1 lever but I can fit 2 road tubes in the tube holder. Stays secure, doesn't wobble around or bounce like most bags do. If you have a Specialized saddle, get this.
review.name: Dig it

name: Mountain Bandit Bag

review.reviewBody: I got a men's XS because it was on sale, and I liked the color (I usually wear a women’s small). I love the color in person. The jacket is well-made and warm. The very bottom is a bit small around, so I can’t pull it completely straight down (would go to my thighs), but it's totally fine to wear on my waist.
review.name: Awesome colors

review.reviewBody: Purchased this jacket for my son in law. He lives in Vermont and needed a jacket with a hood. This jacket is made of high quality material and has a hood which is very important when you live in Vermont. He is delighted!
review.name: Hooded Down Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my first down jacket from Cotopaxi and I have to say I am impressed with the warmth and comfort of the Fuego. The zipper is silky smooth (compared to my Marmot & North Face jackets) and I like the more fitted style of the jacket. It is noticeably warmer than my Marmot Highlander jacket, which is to be expected since the Marmot is 700 fill-power vs. the Fuego's 800 fill-power. I have worn the Fuego around town in 42-degree weather with only a t-shirt underneath and was plenty warm. Very happy with my purchase!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: The jacket is comfortable, light and warm. I am able to fit two layers underneath it as well as there’s plenty of room. Love the colors and you can tell the material and zippers are high quality.
review.name: Excellent value for my money

review.reviewBody: The greatest purchased!! Will buy again for gifting!
review.name: The greatest purchased!! Will buy

review.reviewBody: Love the style, fit, and feel of the jacket. I decided to size up from a medium to a large to allow me to wear an extra layer underneath for skiing and for generally wearing outdoors. Overall a great jacket so far, and can't wait to wear it more throughout the winter.
review.name: Best down jacket around

review.reviewBody: My husband loves how lightweight yet warm this is. Plus it’s a great color and he gets compliments on it all the time.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This was the perfect gift for my boyfriend. He loved the color scheme and the sizing was perfect. I sized up to allow for layering.
review.name: Great gift!

review.reviewBody: I really like the design of this coat but it doesn't seem well made. Stitching is already coming loose and down is leaking out. I plan to return.
review.name: Doubt it will last

review.reviewBody: It is the most comfortable, warm and flexible winter jacket i have ever own. Among all my wintet jacket, this is the most excellent wearable and warm protection jacketm
review.name: Fuego Hooded Down

name: Fuego Hooded Down Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love this style, fit, and quality of the Fjallraven Keb Fleece! It doesn't feel like you standard fleece jacket with the wool and elastane materials blended in it, it actually feels more premium and durable. Great for adding on top of an underlayer/shirt and stylish enough to go outside with. Highly recommend it and worth your money!

It's more fitted than not, I tried a medium and it was like wet suite on me. Unless you're already trim, I suggest a larger size (large fit me perfectly). Don't hesitate!
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: Aside from the vida pro trousers I think this is a perfect investment for winter hikes and bushcraft. I wore this on a winter hike in the cold wet north woods and it kept me warm and was highly functional. I wore it paired with a merino wool long sleeve and it worked like a charm. My only complaint is that they don’t have other colors in the size of mine. I would purchase more. If you see other reviews on this talking about the improved fit. I’m a larger guy, 6’4, 250lbs aside from hiking, eating is another favorite hobby of mine and this fleece fits me perfectly and is form fitting well. There once was a time I was cold. Not anymore though.
review.name: There once was a time I was cold.

review.reviewBody: I bought this from our local store December of last year. I’ve worn it every week since then. Fits great, very comfortable, just the right temp as I get hot easily. Very well made like most of Fjall Raven products. Looking to purchase another color.
review.name: Couldn’t be any more perfect!

review.reviewBody: New fit stinks. Old version was rockstar baselayer or outerlayer for slender athletic types. Old one was great for anything from ice climbing to duck shooting. Didn't get in the way of sporting tools!
review.name: Old Goood. New bad.

review.reviewBody:
I have three of these hoodies in the previous version, and they fit perfectly. In fact, they’re what got me hooked on Fjallraven as a brand. For those of us with a fit, slender build, the “old“ Keb fleece was one of the few options available that actually had a slim, close-to-body silhouette - the ideal, warm, stretchy, wool-blend mid-layer to wear over a tee or active base layer. I can’t help but feel a little covert when I slip one on.

Why Fjallraven had to “fix” something that wasn’t broken - when there are already dozens of options for other body types - is a huge disappointment IMO. Having just received one of the new versions in my usual size small, it now has a more “relaxed” potato-sack-y fit similar to so many other fleece products out there. It’s at least 2 inches longer, so even on my 6 ft. (182 cm) frame, the hem hits near bottom-of-crotch. I can’t imagine this fitting someone under 5’-9” (175 cm). The sleeves are now “poofier” and the chest is wider/looser - which I suppose is fine if you have a lumberjack build to fill it out - but again, there are plenty of other fleece jackets made for that body type.

I found a couple of the “old” versions still available online and snagged them while I could, so I can have several to rotate for many more years to come. Those are a 5.0 in my book; the new one is maybe a 2.5 (I rounded down.) Bummer.
review.name: New Fit Is NOT Necessarily Improved!

review.reviewBody: I bought this fleece 2 winters ago and I loved it but it was too tight around the arms and chest. I pretty much had to use it as a base layer as even a shirt made it uncomfortably tight. I'm a large in everything, XL is too big. I saw online "improved fit" so I stopped in at a store in Cambridge, MA and tried it on and was super happy about the fit. It's now a mid-layer like it's supposed to be. I'm very happy as I had to give my other one away to my nephew.
review.name: Love the improved fit

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these. The first was green and was purchased in 2021. The second was black and was purchased in 2023. Both will be in my wardrobe for many years to come! This being said, after a half year of owning the black version I have noticed that the wear is considerably higher, even with greater care taken on this garment. I’m still satisfied but wonder if perhaps the blend changed over the last two years?
review.name: High Quality Garment!

review.reviewBody: Have three! Plus the vest. Wear any time all the time. Pure comfort. Problem now I’ve moved to much warmer climes. So gotta pack them up and head to winterscapes!
review.name: Have THREE!

review.reviewBody:
I picked this up because I needed an active fleece that could wick moisture. After testing in 20 degree F weather, it held up well just standing around and was comparable to a Patagonia Better Sweater. For active use, it has no comparison. I summited Mt Washington in the winter with this, and barely needed anything else. The weather was 20 degrees. I wore only this the majority of the day besides adding a light jacket for some windy sections. I was amazed how it wicked moisture when I started sweating, but also kept me warm when we were in the snow and wind.

Sizing: I am 5'11 and roughly 170 with a slim athletic build. The large is pretty great, with good sleeve length, and the hood fits well and provides protection. I would say it is slightly tight around the shoulders. If you wear a heavy long sleeve shirt underneath, maybe size up.
review.name: Amazing Fleece

review.reviewBody:
Great everyday hoodie. Smooth and sleek on the outside and cozy on the inside.

Not super breathable but that's what the zipper is for, right?

I'd recommend sizing up one size from what you'd normally go for, if possible. Would love to see Fjallraven extend their sizing.
review.name: Love this one

name: Keb Fleece Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Sternum strap broke then first time i put on pack and tightened it.
review.name: Sternum strap breaks easily
comment: We're sorry that the sternum strap broke on your Zulu. This issue is likely covered by warranty. Please reach out to our customer service team to resolve the issue.

review.reviewBody: Great colorway. This pack fits my partner comfortably and nicely! Super sleek look but also very durable.
review.name: Durable & great looking pack!

review.reviewBody: Good pack, I use this for search and rescue and it holds all my gear and then some extra space for team gear if needed. Not too heavy either, will carry a full load with 2,000 calories of food and 3 liters of water + whatever else you could need (camp stove, extra layers, maps, medical supplies, etc.). One downside is it doesn’t come with a rain cover but those are pretty cheap to find elsewhere.

Bought this a month or so ago to get into backpacking,   Took it on a 3 day 2 night hike and was able to pack everything I needed and a few things I did not need, since I am a newbie to backpacking.  The 55L is a good pack for a long weekend as a new backpack enthusiast.  And probably longer if you have your gear dialed in.   It was comfortable, even with 41 pounds.  Of which 12 pounds was food and water.   Definitely recommend it.
review.name: Comfortable,  loads feel light

review.reviewBody: I haven’t had a chance to get this thing up the hill yet, but I am blown away by how comfortable it is. I was a bit disappointed when I found that it didn’t come with the raincover, but after finding out that this model doesn’t come with a raincover I felt much less ripped off… I would definitely recommend this pack.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: My Gregory Zulu 55 takes all the gear I can throw at it! I’m an outdoor guide, and I carry a first aid kit, extra clothing layers, food, water, and more. This pack has excellent capacity plus it fits very comfortably with light and heavy loads. The rain cover fits well, and the 3 liters of water keep me hydrated! The stretch compartments the outside of the pack accommodate drink containers and more! The mesh on the outside of the pack will also fit a rain jacket and more! The top lid is divided into two generous compartments as well, and you can keep small items handy on the hip belly pockets!
review.name: Fantastic Pack

name: Zulu 55L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Failed the test on a small stormy day. Soaked inside out. I may took a slightly larger size, but the lack of adjustment features is also a design failure.

1. No wrist pocket for RFID, i have to do a squat on every door.
2. No inner pocket to store my phone, battery dead on mountain because I can only store it on the ouside pocket.
3. The adjustment string is hard to pull, and I didn't find hood string until the 4th day.
4. No mesh on the vent, snows flow in when i fall and soaked me out.
5. Given the snow skirt, but no double zip, makes no sense.
6. Same GORETEX, but I feel the texture is less tough than my old one.
review.name: Missing many small useful features to be good

review.reviewBody:
Well made. Fit is great. Not super thick even though it is insulated which I like. 

The colour-the orange is not too bright. It is more of a burnt orange which was a pleasant surprise.
review.name: Colour is awesome! More of a dark/burnt orange.

review.reviewBody: I got this as a replacement for a previous OR Tungsten. Jacket is great but I cannot figure out why the new model doesn't have a wrist pocket for RFID cards?

Overall, this is a high quality jacket with a cool color way. A bit thinner and lighter than I expected but seems to insulate well regardless. Durability seems good for most general resort purposes but maybe not for trees. Pockets are good but wish there was a zippered inner pocket instead of a pouch.
review.name: Good jacket overall with a few small things

review.reviewBody: I wore the Tungsten II for a week strait of resort skiing and absolutely loved the jacket. It was my first time on actual ski slopes, and I had the fall count to prove it. I'm not kidding, this jacket took a serious beating at the beginning and a few branch swipes once I was brave enough to do some woods runs. The first few days would have been unbearable if it weren't for this jacket and the Snowcrew Bibs. I never got snow in places it wasn't supposed to be, and I was able to regulate my body temperature with the vents quite effectively. The chest pockets are a great depth and size, the hand pockets large enough for gloved hands and quite warm. The hood fit perfectly over my helmet and was secured appropriately by the cinch cord. The Blue and Orange color scheme is quite fashionable, and garnered several nice complements that left me chuffed. After a full week on the slopes, the jacket is in excellent condition.
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: Like the looks, fit, and waterproof nature of the jacket but it is simply not durable at all. This jacket has been on exactly 2 ski days on nothing but groomers. New to the sport, and had one fall on pretty soft snow. Unfortunately the jacket now has a tear in the back. Really surprised at this and would think it would not be so delicate. Super disappointing- wonder how this fabric has been test since it does not seem good for outdoor sport applications. Definitely do not recommend.
review.name: Not a durable jacket

review.reviewBody: I've only been using a shell jacket for the last 5 years when skiing the resort, because I'm not a fan of bulky insulated jackets. I saw this and felt it may hit the sweet spot of light insulation for cold resort days, but able to work with different layering for other days. The jacket has worked out well. A few thoughts that could be improved upon: The powder skirt would be nice if its removeable as I've never used them, but it doesn't really get in the way. Second the OR logo stitched onto the right sleeve looks like it will tear off sooner rather than later. It would have been nice to use a different branding technique. Overall a great jacket and continues the run of quality gear from OR. I'm debating adding the Tungsten pants, but the color options leave something to be desired.
review.name: Great Jacket with light insulation

review.reviewBody: I am an OR Employee and skied in sample of this jacket a lot last winter, especially cold-temp night skiing and on storm days, as well as some frigid resort skiing in the Rockies. It's an perfect piece for all of these situations with the Gore fabric, mid-weight insulation and good venting. As a taller guy, I like the fit too, which is plenty long in the body and sleeves, but not baggy.
review.name: Great Jacket for Cold Temps and Storm Days

review.reviewBody: Very warm, plenty of pockets
review.name: Great features, warm, lots of pockets

review.reviewBody: I bought this mostly because of the price. And the design was different from your usual multiple horizontal lines of stitching/seams. The vest has a very useful number of pockets - I use the "beverage" pockets for my phone and can stick my hands in my hand pockets unencumbered for warmth. The external chest zip pocket is nice for my wallet and/or phone. There are additional mesh pockets on the inside flaps. The material feels more durable than your average down vest and somewhat water resistant - though I have not tried to go in the rain with this. The negative is that this jacket feels and looks a bit "baggy" compared to my other vests. It serves has a good underlayer or late spring vest since air seems to flow freely thru the arm holes. I will likely use this for summer camping or hiking. Oddly, this feels among the least warm of my small collection of vests.
review.name: Found on sale and owned for a 2.5 months

review.reviewBody: Great vest! Fits well feels great and comfortable.
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: Great for being on your feet all day. Love how adjustable they are and that they are easy to clean if needed.

review.reviewBody: I love my chaos ! I love walking in them hiking in them . They feel like they are apart of me .
review.name: ❤️chaos

review.reviewBody: My new chacos are not a true size 10. My big toes is at the edge. My others are not like that.
review.name: Too short
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Cush Core XC Tire Insert - Pair online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Installed these to protect my Nobl TR32 wheels.  Ran this setup at the Dakota Five-O and ran less pressure but had no issues.  No flats was the key for me on a 50 mile race!
review.name: They worked thats what mattered!

review.reviewBody:
I installed Cush Core XC in my Sawyer last night. It is =° =% AMAZING
I dropped my air pressure 5 psi front and rear. 

Currently running 15.5psi front and 16.5 psi rear.

Relax it's a rigid single speed. I'm not hitting any corners that hard. But the Cush Core added a substantial amount of support to the tires. They cornered better and were less wobbly than they were at 20-21 psi.

I hit plenty of sharp square edge rocks nice and hard with no unsettling thud of my carbon rims.

I also followed the directions on installation. 
I have heard horror stories but those people must have done it all wrong. 
They might have added 10 minutes total to my install time of both tires.
If even that. 
I didn't even have to swear at them.
Buy the Bead Dropper Tool, it is worth every penny.

I will 100% be running Cush Core in my Full Squish and Gravel bikes.
Truly a game changer.
review.name: Like a dropper post. MUST HAVE!

name: XC Tire Insert - Pair

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this shoes it’s my favorite ones and also looks great with jeans or shorts and they are very comfy to walk you can wear them for a long time 
I have to buy a other pair for me and one more for my son 
I highly recommend them
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These Moku's are great warm weather shoes.  I have wide feet and the width of these shoes are perfect.  They are breathable and allows me to wear them without socks.  I don't think they are to be worn daily due to the lack of support.
review.name: Great lounging shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shoe looks great and feels great. They are easy slip one and do not look like actual slip ones. Nice new version of a boat shoe or dockside type shoe. The insert is extra comfy. My wife and I are having our first child and these will be perfect to wear in the hospital during our stay. They can go with athletic wear and dress them up some for a casual look. The packaging is also very sleek! Nice product and will look at getting another pair in the future!
review.name: Nice slip on and lightweight shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so comfortable to wear anywhere, I love the feel and the look of them. Olukai is by far the most well made shoes I've ever had. Just being able to slip into them with ease is great. Living in Florida it gives my outfits and me a little more tropical,  but comfortable feel and look. I'm very picky about my shoes and these are great, I'll be getting a few more pairs to complete my wardrobe.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes are very comfortable. They don't have a lot of padding in the insole but just enough to make them comfortable. They run true to size. They slip on super easy and don't have laces to tie but they have the look of laced shoes. The sole isn't super aggressive but still has great traction on a wet surface. When you get them wet, they dry pretty quickly. They're light weight and look great. They're the perfect shoe to wear around the pool, on the boat, or at the beach. I love them. These shoes are stylish and practical plus support a great cause to boot!
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shoes are a neutral gray which pretty much go with anything, perfect for jeans or shorts or if you use them functionally as boat shoes. Personally I will be wearing them as sneakers. They fit true to size and I think can be worn with or without socks. My favorite part is the no tie laces. I usually just keep my sneaker laces tied loose so I can slip them on and off easily and that is functionally how these come. They have plenty of arch support. Great shoes.
review.name: Comfy and stylish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is really cool new look and a very comfortable shoe. I've worn this brand's leather sandals now for probably ten years and this still look great so I decided to give the new shoe a try. These are a slip-on which is not really clear by just looking at the pictures as it appears to have laces (but they are only looped in a stretch to fit). For me, I ordered my usual shoes size, but probably would have gone 1/2 size smaller for a little big snugger fit. Be sure to check the sizing chart and maybe go a half size smaller. The color and styling is really cool. Fit is very comfortable as I've worn them all day at my stand-up desk at work too.
review.name: Very cool designed contemporary shoe!

name: Nohea Moku Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Possibly the finest shoe I’ve ever worn. A technical mountain trail masterpiece; almost an alpine-mountaineering boot morphed into a perfect running shoe. Comfortable out of the box, though still in need of a proper break-in, they delivered outstanding grip on continuous rock, which gave me supreme confidence in steep sections and on speedy, technical descents. They feel like I can go hard in them all day. I wore them once and immediately purchased a second pair for when the first are toast. VERY highly recommended. Also, I wear a 47/13 in every other Sportiva model I own and these fit perfectly just like the rest. In American shoes I wear a 12. Zero fit problems.
review.name: Mountain Masterpiece

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a size 10 in most brands. Had to go w an 11.5 w these. Comfort is great, the boa works well. Loads of tracking. The neoprene gator is amazing.
review.name: Sizing is off but great shoe

review.reviewBody: I didn't have the chance to try them due to sizing misinformation.  The sizing chart stated that Euro 47 was equivalent to US Mens 13.  In reality, they were smaller than US Mens 12.  Now I am out for the return shipping.  I find this a lot with Italian footwear.  Italian men just need to admit that they have small feet.
review.name: Sizing way off

review.reviewBody: Completed my first 5 miles on the trails and overall felt nice. Ordered 46.5+ and I’m a US 12 and they fit well. Unfortunately I was surprised to find the stitching that holds the integrated gator together starting to come loose. By loose I mean 4 inches of stitching material backing out of a seam on one shoe and stitching coming loose on other. Disappointing as I will be returning after only one run.
review.name: Nice shoe but quality issues

review.reviewBody:
These are really solid, only knock is that the forward pull tab is too small to get your finger in to pull properly.
They also run a bit small I'd suggest going .5 up.
review.name: Pretty Good
comment: Hey Clayton you said they run small so I did order a .5 bigger size , the .5 isn?t going to be to big in size ? Thank you

name: Cyklon Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Pro Team Regular Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have 4 pairs of bibs that I rotate through... Castelli, Pearl Izumi, Giordana and these. And all are at the same price point.  These bibs are super comfortable with an excellent chamois that doesn't move and is well padded.  The leg cuffs are nice and wide and don't move up the legs.  There are zero pressure points.  I've worn these on days when the temp is close to 100 degrees and I don't even know I have them on.  They breath well and wick sweat perfectly.  I'm a high cadence rider with an average rpm of 96 and I've found that the chamois in some bibs have a tendency to move around, causing irritation even when using a chamois creme like that made by Assos.  The chamois in these stays in place regardless of cadence or getting out of the saddle to climb or sprint.   I'll end up getting another pair when the time comes to swap out.
review.name: My favorite Bibs!

name: Pro Team Regular Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Works great as a windbreaker, but during any serious downpour the jacket just soaks up the rain. On top of that the "waterproofing flaps" meant to keep water from getting through the zipper constantly get stuck in said zipper. Only plus is i guess it pack's down pretty well for travel... Idk why i didn't return it right away an used it the past 3 years
review.name: Zipper sticks and the jacket wets out

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few years ago, and while it worked well as a windbreaker, it wetted out on every single serious shower that it's been through. This is the case even when it was brand new, so much so that I contacted Patagonia for a warranty claim. I never wear it anymore and replaced it with the Marmot Minimalist jacket, which has been bombproof.
review.name: Wets out almost immediately

name: Torrentshell Jacket - Men's
